message.content:
Oxalis latifolia, commonly known as Broadleaf wood-sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant.
It has a slender, upright growth habit with triangular shaped leaves that are bright green in color and about 3-lobed.
The leaves are around 2–4 cm long, and 3–6 mm wide.
The flowers of the Oxalis latifolia are small, white or pale pink with 5 petals, and measure approximately 1.5 cm in diameter.
It typically blooms during the summer months, from June to September.
Oxalis latifolia is commonly found in wooded areas, meadows and fields across North America.
The plant is often used as an ornamental plant in gardens and landscaping because of its attractive foliage and flowers.
